intro: Ornithogalum yesilyurtense, commonly known as the Yesilyurt bulbous lily, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground stem. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers with six petals, which bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or grassy areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
